docs.lead_paragraph: Irish doctors who have been keeping a brain-dead pregnant woman on life support in hope of saving her 17-week-old fetus pleaded in court Tuesday to be permitted to turn off the machines because their treatment was becoming horrific and could not end in a successful birth.

headline.main: Doctors: Take Pregnant Irishwoman Off Life Support
headline.print_headline: Doctors: Take Pregnant Irishwoman Off Life Support

docs.snippet: Irish doctors who have been keeping a brain-dead pregnant woman on life support in hope of saving her 17-week-old fetus pleaded in court Tuesday to be permitted to turn off the machines because their treatment was becoming horrific and could not end...

docs.lead_paragraph: Beata Bien, who emigrated from Poland in 1993, was abandoned by her boyfriend after she learned she was pregnant. Then she learned that she had cancer and that there were people who could help.

headline.main: Facing Cancer and Financial Burdens, an Immigrant Finds Aid
headline.print_headline: Help for an Immigrant With Cancer and Bills

docs.abstract: Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens, one of the seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, gives Beata Bien $400 to catch up on her rent.
docs.snippet: Beata Bien, who emigrated from Poland in 1993, was abandoned by her boyfriend after she learned she was pregnant. Then she learned that she had cancer and that there were people who could help.

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: By practicing “sperm diplomacy,” a Senate staffer became a central facilitator of the Cuba shift.

headline.main: How a Cuban Spy and His Wife Came to Be Expectant Parents
headline.print_headline: How a Cuban Spy and His Wife Came to Be Expectant Parents

docs.abstract: Ernesto Londono Editorial Observer column examines efforts of Tim Rieser, Senate staffer who was at center of group that worked secretly for years to bring about thaw in relations between the United States and Cuba; notes that Rieser took it upon himself to deal with the 'human' element of diplomacy, including odd but important instance in which he arranged for the transfer of an imprisoned Cuban spy's sperm to Panama, where his wife was desperate to have a baby.
docs.snippet: By practicing “sperm diplomacy,” a Senate staffer became a central facilitator of the Cuba shift.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cuba is celebrating the return of three intelligence agents imprisoned in the United States for more than a decade, and the joyful but puzzling news that one of their wives is expecting just two weeks from now.

headline.main: Wife of Cuban Agent Freed From US Expecting Baby
headline.print_headline: Wife of Cuban Agent Freed From US Expecting Baby

docs.snippet: Cuba is celebrating the return of three intelligence agents imprisoned in the United States for more than a decade, and the joyful but puzzling news that one of their wives is expecting just two weeks from now.

docs.lead_paragraph: New Jersey can't conclude a mother abused and neglected her baby because the child was born exhibiting symptoms of methadone withdrawal due to the mother's use of the drug, the state Supreme Court ruled in an opinion released Monday.

headline.main: Court Sides With Mom Who Gave Birth While on Methadone
headline.print_headline: Court Sides With Mom Who Gave Birth While on Methadone

docs.snippet: New Jersey can't conclude a mother abused and neglected her baby because the child was born exhibiting symptoms of methadone withdrawal due to the mother's use of the drug, the state Supreme Court ruled in an opinion released Monday.
